description:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus. As a Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders. Your projects often span offices, time zones and hemispheres, and it's your job to keep all the players coordinated on the project's progress and deadlines.

As a Supply Chain Design Program Manager, you will use analytical and quantitative methods to understand, develop transformative supply chain models and processes centered around factory planning, order scheduling, network optimization, inventory optimization, and capacity optimization.

You should have a track record of thriving in ambiguous environments where you conceived supply chain improvement ideas, forecasted the expected result, worked with cross-functional teams to gain buy-off and executed cross-functionally to turn ideas into reality. You also must have the ability and interest to work in an environment where you create and analyze your own data and have the ability to articulate key findings to team members as well as senior leadership. Your data backed analysis will help steer the organization's direction.

You will also drive the data and analytics priorities for the supply chain organization in order to enable access to reliable, clean and easy-to-use data for ad-hoc and standardized reporting. The successful candidate must feel comfortable with defining deliverables, aligning ownership and driving implementation of your own ideas in a highly cross-functional environment, while communicating with senior leaders on your progress, risks and accomplishments. You will own the implementation of our supply chain data warehouse infrastructure.

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We're always on call to keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • BS degree in Engineering or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of work experience in supply chain operations/manufacturing/program management
  • 3 years of experience in data science, data visualization and/or business intelligence in a supply chain vertical
  • 1 year of experience with SQL, Python, Java or Tableau.

Preferred qualifications:

  • MBA or MS/PhD in Engineering, Operations Research, Applied Mathematics or similar.
  • 10 years of work experience in supply chain operations/manufacturing/program management
  • 5 years of experience in data science, data visualization and/or business intelligence across all supply chain SCOR functions
  • 5 years of experience working with large data sets using SQL, Python, Tableau, and similar tools
  • Experience running ongoing planning operations at multiple different businesses using a newly developed or integrated advanced planning mode.
  • Ability to successfully lead projects and work across multiple levels of an organization to implement business intelligence initiatives from the ground up.
  • Excellent problem solving and strong analytical skills, as well as written and verbal communication and influencing skills.
responsibilities:
• Brainstorm, program manage, develop and implement supply chain models/processes centered around: Supply Chain Network Design, Manufacturing Production, Schedule, Factory Planning, Order Scheduling, Product Catalog, Logistics (forward/reverse), Inventory and Resource Optimization
  • Work with business users to gather requirements, design, build, test and maintain end-to-end reporting solutions and infrastructure including a data warehouse, centralized reporting and rationalization of data sources
  • Lead implementation of organization-wide dashboards and ad-hoc custom reporting using data visualization tools; Develop predictive models, analyses and simulations to support the business, while incorporating machine learning practices where appropriate
  • Drive change management for the organization’s data strategy by communicating across all levels, getting things done without supervision in an ambiguous environment, and becoming an advocate for data analytics within the supply chain organization
title: Supply Chain Design Program Manager
